ZT2Strings.LOC_STRING: This picture fulfills a photo challenge requirement.
Promotional Photos

The marketing department is preparing a new zoo brochure and has requested pictures of the following:
* A guest holding an ice cold soda,
* A guest sitting on a bench.
Providing these pictures will help improve your zoo fame as flyers promoting your zoo begin to circulate around your community.
Photograph a guest drinking an ice cold soda and a guest sitting on a bench.

Marketing has received your pictures of a guest drinking an ice cold soda and a guest sitting on a bench. The new glossy brochure has been distributed around your community and news of your zoo is spreading rapidly!
Great pictures! Your completed brochure will have a positive impact on zoo fame.
Take a picture of a guest sitting on a bench.
Take a picture of a guest holding a soda.
Scientific Journal

Your local city council and animal welfare society want to run a promotion at your zoo granting residents of your community half price admissions. They hope to deliver the message that proper care and feeding is essential to all animals, and that domestic animals deserve the same attention as the exotic animals in your zoo. They have agreed to pay you an upfront fee of $5000. This promotion will last for 6 months as long as your animals remain healthy. If any of your animals become ill, the promotion will end immediately and no further compensation will be received. At the end of the promotion period, if no animals became ill, they will also compensate you for your lost admissions fees.
Provide a photograph of a Dromedary Camel, Gemsbok, and Thomson's Gazelle.
Provide a photograph of a Dromedary Camel.
Provide a photograph of a Gemsbok.
Provide a photograph of a Thomson's Gazelle.
The journal loved your photos! You have been paid $1500 for the photos and you are sure to gain increased popularity as a result of the published article.
Your photos will really enhance the piece on Even-Toed Ungulates.
Take a picture of a Dromedary Camel.
Take a picture of a Gemsbok.
Take a picture of a Thomson's Gazelle.
Zoo New Monthly

Zoo News Monthly wants to run an article on your zoo but needs pictures to back up their story. They want particularly compelling photographs and once you provide the photos, they can run the news piece which will have a positive impact on your attendance for the next 3 months that the issue is displayed on the news stands.

Provide the following photographs:
* A Jaguar swimming in the water.
* An Emperor Penguin spreading its wings.
* A Moose rubbing its antlers on a tree.

The Zoo news article looks fantastic and the photos were so impressive that your zoo has gotten a mention on the magazine cover! Your attendance is sure to get a boost while the magazine stays on the news stands.
Your photos were fantastic. Your zoo was given a cover mention on Zoo News Monthly's magazine cover!
Take a single photo a Jaguar swimming in the water.
Take a photo of an Emperor Penguin spreading its wings.
Take a picture of a Moose rubbing its antlers.
High School Class Demonstration

The local high school is currently studying the concept of the food chain. They would like to demonstrate this concept to the class and have asked if you can provide a sequence of pictures demonstrating how the food chain works. They will be sure to spread the word to other schools about the help you have provided and this will enhance your attendance.

Take a series of 2 pictures that show a predatory animal:
* identifying or stalking its prey,
* o catching their prey.
The photographs really helps the students grasp the concept of the food chain and they were totally engrossed during the class on the subject.
The photographs really helped the students understand what the food chain is all about.
Take a photo of a carnivore identifying and stalking its prey.
Take a photo of a carnivore catching its prey.
Building Design

Zoo Design, Inc. is running a trade piece on maximizing guest amenities and is particularly interested in your building design. They will mention your zoo in their article, boosting your zoo fame, if you provide them with pictures of some of your buildings.

They would like pictures of the following buildings:
* Family Restroom
* Gift Shop
* Animal Photo Booth
* Any food stand
Your photographs of your zoo buildings were used to demonstate excellent building design. Guests are sure to be impressed by the accolades received by your zoo.
The photographs showed off your excellent building design.
Take a photo of a Family Restroom.
Take a photo of a Gift Shop.
Take a photo of an Animal Photo Booth.
Take a photo of any food stand.
Gardening Society Demonstration

The Gardening Society is interested in your display of plant life and has asked you to make a presentation about the foliage in your park. They will pay you $3000 for your appearance. To support your presentation, you will need 4 photographs of plant life from 4 different regions of the world, where each picture shows the foliage displayed in its appropriate biome. The presentation will increase public awareness by appealing to an audience that may not be aware that your zoo offers more than just animals.

You need to provide the following photos:
* Baobob: Savannah biome, Africa
* Kapok: Tropical Rainforest, South America
* Tamarack: Boreal Forest, North America
* Himalayan Pine: Alpine, China
Your foliage presentation was a huge success. With standing room only crowds, a second session was added your your fee was doubled to $6000!
Your foliage presentation was a hit and your fee was doubled to $6000!
Take a photo of a Baobob tree.
Take a photo of a Kapok tree.
Take a photo of a Tamarack tree.
Take a photo of a Himalayan Pine tree.
National Zoo Association Contest

The National Zoo Association is running a contest among all member zoos and will award all participants with a $25000 grant. They have requested 4 pictures of rare zoo events like animal births/animal babies with mothers, animal interactions (grooming or socializing) and animals making use of enrichment objects.

Capture specific images as follows:
* Any young animal born in your zoo.
* Any animal baby with its mother.
* Two Common Zebras grooming each other.
* Any animal using an enrichment object.
Your photographs of hard to capture zoo events like animal births and young animals with their mothers have earned you a $25,000 grant!
Your photos of hard to capture zoo events have earned you a $25,000 grant!
Take a photo of any baby animal.
Take a photo of a baby animal with its mother.
Take a photo of two Common Zebras grooming each other.
Take a photo of any animal using an enrichment object.
Center for Animal Conservation Contest

The Center for Animal Conservation has issued an open contest to obtain pictures of endangered animals. Winners will receive the Animal Conservation Image Award and a cash bonus of $15,000. The required animals are: Bengal Tiger, Snow Leopard, Mountain Gorilla, and Grizzly Bear.

Capture 1 picture of each of the following animals to qualify for the award.
* Bengal Tiger
* Snow Leopard
* Mountain Gorilla
* Grizzly Bear
Your photographs of endangered animals were magnificent and earned first place. You a have won $15,000 and the Animal Conservation Image Award!
Your photos of endangered animals have earned you $15,000 and the Animal Conservation Image Award!
Take a photo of a Bengal Tiger.
Take a photo of a Snow Leopard.
Take a photo of a Mountain Gorilla.
Take a photo of a Grizzly Bear.
Scientific Journal Follow-up Article

You have been approached by the scientific journal for a second series of pictures on the Dromedary Camel, Gemsbok and the Thomson's Gazelle. They will pay you $1500 per picture for photographs that capture these animals performing specific activities.

Capture these animals performing the following activities:
* A Dromedary Camel grooming another camel.
* A Gemsbok sleeping in the shade.
* A Thomson's Gazelle greeting another gazelle.
The scientific journal was pleased with the latest round of pictures and has paid you your $4500 fee.
Your second batch of Even-Toed Ungulate pictures have earned you $4500.
The scientific journal's deadline for the second batch of Even-Toed Ungulate pictures has expired. Unfortunately they've had to go ahead without your photographs.
Unfortunately the deadline for the second batch of Even-Toed Ungulate pictures has expired.
Take a photo of a Dromedary Camel grooming another camel.
Take a photo of a Gemsbok sleeping in the shade.
Take a photo of a Thomson's Gazelle greeting another gazelle.
Bistro Magazine

Bistro Magazine wants a unique angle for an upcoming issue and would like to feature photographs of animals eating from interesting containers. They have requested pictures of specific animals and will pay you $2000 per photo.

Provide the following photographs:
* A Bengal Tiger eating meat from an artificial carcass.
* A Reticulated Giraffe eating branches from a browse holder.
* A Ring-Tailed Lemur eating from an elevated food dish.

Bistro Magazine was thrilled with your photographs. The Bengal Tiger eating meat from the artificial carcass was a perfect backdrop for the serving suggestions for BBQ ribs! And the browse holder made the presentation of the salad course an interesting feature by itself.
Your photos of animals eating from interesting containers earned you $6000!
Take a photo of a Bengal Tiger eating meat from an artificial carcass.
Take a photo of a Reticulated Giraffe eating branches from a browse holder.
Take a photo of a Ring-Tailed Lemur eating from an elevated food dish.
Animal Enrichment

A national conference has scheduled a session on the topic of psychological stimulation for animals in captivity. You have been offered a spot on the interactive panel segment and have been asked to provide photographs to support the discussion. You will be paid $20,000 if you participate and provide photographs of the required animals.

Capture photographs of the following animals:
* A Giant Panda using a car tire.
* An African Elephant using the easel.
* A Cheetah lying on a heated rock.
* A Black Rhinoceros playing with a pursuit ball.

Your participation in the interactive panel segment on the topic of psychological stimulation for animals in captivity was extremely polished. The spectacular photos of your animals performing interesting actions was a great demonstation of animals acheiving enrichment from unusual objects. You received a $20,000 fee for your appearance.
Your photos of animals using interesting object were a polished addition to your conference participation! You received a $20,000 fee for your appearance.
Take a photo of a Giant Panda using a car tire.
Take a photo of an African Elephant using the easel.
Take a photo of a Cheetah lying on a heated rock.
Take a photo of a Black Rhinoceros playing with a pursuit ball.
Animal Instincts

A group of ethologists will be visiting your zoo to further their studies of animal instinctual behaviors. To help make their visit more time efficient, they have asked you to capture images of certain behaviors. They have offered share their knowledge of animal behaviors with your guests and you should expect to see increased donations as a result of their visit.

Capture photographs of the following animal behaviors:
* A Ring-tailed Lemur grooming another lemur, satisfying social and hygienic instincts.
* A pride of lions consisting of one adult male, three females and one young lion resting in the shade together.
* An Ostrich doing a mating dance.
* A young giraffe calling to its mother.

The ethologists were amazed to see the range of behaviors that your animals performed and were delighted to share their knowledge with your guests. They found their visit so productive that they stayed twice as long as they expected. Your zoo guests enjoyed the additional information about animal instincts immensely.
The ethologists' visit was a huge success and your guest really enjoyed learning more about the animals.
Take a photo of a Ring-tailed Lemur grooming another lemur.
Take a photo of a pride of lions resting in the shade.
Take a photo of an Ostrich doing a mating dance.
Take a photo of a young giraffe calling to its mother.
Wildlife Photography Lesson

The Alfred Windsor School of Photography would like you to provide them with a photo to use as a sample during the wildlife photography segment of their curriculum. They need only one photograph but to make it more interesting for the students, they would like it to be a close up snapshot that contains at least two animals. In return for this photograph, they will present you with the Alfred Windsor Photography Award of Merit that you can display as an example of your efforts to help the community. Additionally, for entire 4 month semester that the photo is used, you will receive $1000 per month as a licensing fee.

Capture the following photograph:
* Take a close up photo that features two animals.

Your close-up photo of two animals was exceptionally detailed. It was a great example of brilliant wildlife photography. The Alfred Windsor School of Photography has licensed your wildlife photo for 4 months and has presented you with the Alfred Windsor Photography Award of Merit.
The Alfred Windsor School of Photography has licensed your wildlife photo for 4 months and has presented you with the Alfred Windsor Photography Award of Merit.
Take a close up photo that features two animals.
Beckenspot Primate Photographs

A school group will be taking a field trip sponsored by the Beckenspot Charitable Foundation to visit the primates in your zoo. The Foundation would like souvenir photos to give to each of the students as a reminder of their visit. They have asked you to provide one original photo of the following animals and they will take care of making the duplicates. In return for your efforts, they will present you with the Beckenspot Charitable Foundation Photographic Portfolio Award at a black tie awards ceremony recognizing benefactors of the Foundation. The publicity you will receive at this well-heeled event will provide a significant boost to your attendance.

Photographs the following animals:
* Photograph a Mountain Gorilla chuckling.
* Photograph a male Mountain Gorilla calling to his troop.
* Photograph a Chimpanzee using the Monkey Bars.
* Photograph a Chimpanzee climbing a tree.

The Beckenspot Charitable Foundation was grateful for the pictures you were able to provide. The visit was a success and the Foundation really promoted your zoo at their black tie gala. The Beckenspot Charitable Foundation Photographic Portfolio Award is quite impressive. The benefactors of the Foundation have all indicated they will be making a special trip to your facility. The benefits to your attendance and donation collections will be significant.

The Beckenspot Charitable Foundation presented you with the Beckenspot Charitable Foundation Photographic Portfolio Award. The publicity you have received among the benefactors of the Foundation will boost your your attendance and donation collections.
Take a photo of a Gorilla chuckling.
Take a photo of a a Gorilla calling.
Take a photo of a Chimpanzee using the Monkey Bars.
Take a photo of a a Chimpanzee climbing a tree.
Take a photo of a Common Zebra using a scratching post.
Common Zebra Photos
